main event: A sighting of 3 objects slightly larger than planet Venus with golden flashes was reported in San Bernardino, California on May 1, 1961.
interesting points: The objects appeared at 20Â° above the eastern horizon and were visible for about 3 minutes.,The report indicated that the objects had initially golden flashes on their fronts and backs.,Witnesses stated the objects disappeared quickly and traveled on a NW-SE course.,The sighting was from a reliable civilian witness and corroborated by other family members.,The report concluded the objects could be ballistic missiles, but insufficient data for a definitive evaluation.
sighted object: three objects slightly larger than planet Venus
witness description: A civilian witness along with corroborating family members
